pages.text: The $(9)Fortron Capacitor$() serves as an energy storage and management device for MFFS machines. It's designed to collect Fortron generated by $(l:mffs:machines/coercion_deriver)Coercion Deriver$()s and transfer it to other machines that need $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$() to operate, essentially acting as a "hub".

pages.title: Usage
pages.text: Place the Capacitor and set which frequency it should use. By default, Capacitors use frequency number 0, but this can be changed either by:$(li)Right-clicking the Capacitor and entering the desired frequency number into its GUI$(li)Shift-right-clicking the Capacitor while holding a $(l:mffs:tools/frequency_card)Frequency Card$().

Activate the Fortron Capacitor by supplying it with a Redstone signal. Once activated, the Capacitor will change from red to blue and begin transferring $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$() between other MFFS devices that use the same frequency and are within range (default 15 blocks).

pages.title: Upgradability
pages.text: A Fortron Capacitor may be augmented with various modules to enhance its capabilities:$(li)$(l:mffs:upgrade_modules/scale_module)$(5)Scale Module$(): Enables the Capacitor to link with other MFFS machines over a larger distance. Each module increases the range by 1 block from the default of 15 blocks.$(li)$(l:mffs:upgrade_modules/speed_module)$(5)Speed Module$(): Allows the Capacitor to transfer $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$() to and from machines more quickly. Each module increases the transfer rate by 50 FE.
$(li)$(l:mffs:upgrade_modules/capacity_module)$(5)Capacity Module$(): Increases the amount of $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$() the Capacitor is able to store.
